availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen Barnes (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Nancy Barnes. Married to Theresa Barnes. Father of Louisa Barnes, John F. Barnes, and William M. Barnes. Farmer in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 26, 1863, to December 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, 493A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 86.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, 157, p. 421B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0444.
"Stephen Barnes (1831-1912)," Memorial #32949921, Find A Grave, accessed May 5, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/32949921.
